dataset_description.json.HowToAcknowledge: Please acknowledge the authors and cite the following reference: Bahne H Bahners, Roxanne Lofredi, Tilmann Sander, Alfons Schnitzler, Andrea A Kuhn, Esther Florin. Deep brain stimulation device-specific artefacts in MEG recordings. doi: tba
dataset_description.json.Name: sfb_meg_phantom (B04/C01)

README.md:
This dataset is a part of the data used for the study: 'Bahners B.H., Lofredi R. , Sander T., Schnitzler A., Kuhn A.A., Florin E. Deep brain stimulation device-specific artefacts in MEG recordings. 2023, submitted. doi: tba'


Please use the latest version of the dataset.
 

For detailed information about measurement protocol please refer to doi: tba. Additional information about Neuromag Phantom measurement is provided below. 

--------------
Neuromag Phantom Measurement 
Movement onset is recorded with an accelerometer and captured with MISC006-MISC008

sub-abtpc_ses-220616_task-dip13_acq-Stim.InstitutionName: Universitaetsklinikum Duesseldorf, Institute of Clinical Neuroscience and Medical Psychology
sub-abtpc_ses-220616_task-dip13_acq-Stim.TaskDescription: In this phantom setup, there is an inflatable box underneath the gelatine phantom that is filled with air in a fixed time distance of 2 seconds very briefly and simulates physiological movement like the heart beat pulsation. Movement is turned on or off according to the respective task label (mov). Additionally, an electric dipole is activated or turned off at 13 Hz or 7 Hz frequency respectively.
